title: What are the simplest ways to learn new things after being addicted to drugs? - Quora

response.answer_text: By stepping outside of your comfort zone and just giving it your all. The wonderful thing about recovering from addiction is that you get a second chance at life. This is your opportunity to try new things you never thought you were capable of. I recommend you think about what you’ve always wanted to do – dancing, cooking, rock-climbing, gardening, etc. – and sign up for an intro class. This is a great way to try new things and find what you’re passionate about. Having healthy hobbies is an important part of recovering from addiction. Just remember to be patient and don’t expect to be good at everything. Learning something new isn’t about being perfect, it’s about growth.

Depending on what you want to learn, (and I'd go for something simple, cross stitching is my new hobby) YouTube it! Tutorials on YouTube is how I learned cross stitching, and now embroidery, which is harder for me. But I think learning something difficult is also beneficial. The challenge it presents is a great way to take your mind off of things and occupy your time.
